_schema.description: Felix Campaign - Dark Fantasy Painterly style for graphic novel adaptation
_schema.inspiration: Monstress, The Sandman, Magic: The Gathering art
notes: base_style is prepended to all prompts
important_restrictions are appended as warnings to avoid common issues

comic_aesthetic.base_style: Dark fantasy graphic novel illustration. Painterly digital art with rich textures and atmospheric depth. Publication-quality artwork.
comic_aesthetic.art_style: Painterly rendering with visible brushwork and textured surfaces. Rich, layered colors with dramatic chiaroscuro lighting. Moody atmospheric perspective. Intricate details in costumes, architecture, and magical effects. Expressive faces with emotional depth. Oil painting meets digital art aesthetic.
comic_aesthetic.setting_tone: Epic dark fantasy with cosmic horror undertones. A world of ancient magic, imprisoned demons, and forbidden knowledge. Moments range from intimate tragedy to apocalyptic battles. The tone shifts between wonder, dread, and sorrow.
comic_aesthetic.visual_quality: High detail, museum-quality illustration. Rich color depth. Atmospheric lighting that sets mood. Professional fantasy art publication standard.
important_restrictions: Maintain consistent character appearances across panels
Clear readable speech bubbles when dialogue is present
Avoid generic fantasy tropes - this world has specific lore
Library creatures should feel alien and wrong, not standard undead

color_palette.description: Shifting palette that follows emotional beats of the story

primary_moods.adventure: Warm golds, rich browns, forest greens - sense of journey and discovery
primary_moods.horror: Deep purples, sickly greens, void blacks - The Library and its creatures
primary_moods.tragedy: Desaturated blues, cold grays, muted earth tones - loss and sacrifice
primary_moods.demonic: Burnt oranges, infernal reds, sulfur yellows - Rizzmodeus and demon encounters
primary_moods.divine: Pale golds, ethereal whites, soft blues - Soapstone, angels, holy moments
primary_moods.political: Rich jewel tones, deep crimsons, glass greens - Glass Citadel intrigue

signature_elements.the_library: Black sand, void purple, skeletal white - alien and wrong
signature_elements.ring_of_truth: Golden glow with white core - piercing illumination
signature_elements.clowns: Garish colors that feel unsettling against the painterly style
signature_elements.beholder_dreams: Surreal color shifts, eye motifs in reds and yellows

dialogue_rendering.instruction: Include speech bubbles with dialogue text clearly readable. Bubbles should have a slightly rough, hand-drawn quality that fits the painterly style. Position bubbles to not obscure important visual elements. Use parchment-tinted bubbles for narration, white for speech, jagged for shouting, wispy for whispers or magical speech.

panel_guidelines.action_scenes: Dynamic compositions with dramatic lighting. Motion suggested through blur and energy effects rather than speed lines. Painterly chaos for battle scenes.
panel_guidelines.dialogue_scenes: Intimate framing with expressive faces. Rich environmental details. Warm or cool lighting to match emotional tone.
panel_guidelines.establishing_shots: Sweeping vistas with atmospheric perspective. Architecture and landscape rendered with care. Set mood before action.
panel_guidelines.horror_scenes: Deep shadows, limited light sources. Library creatures partially obscured. Wrongness in proportions and angles.
panel_guidelines.tragic_scenes: Desaturated palette, soft focus backgrounds. Focus on character emotion. Space for grief.

character_rendering.style: Detailed but not photorealistic. Expressive features. Distinctive silhouettes. Costumes with texture and wear.
character_rendering.faces: Emotional range is key. Eyes convey inner state. Scars and marks tell stories.
character_rendering.poses: Dynamic action poses. Weighted and grounded standing poses. Body language communicates personality.

creature_design.library_entities: Skeletal but wrong. Black wings, void-touched. Ancient and alien. Not standard undead - something from outside reality.
creature_design.demons: Each of the Three Humors has distinct aesthetic: Rizzmodeus (fire, rage), Midas (gold, greed), Dionysus (revelry, excess).
creature_design.beholderkin: Eye motifs throughout. Chromium should feel like a god-being, not a standard D&D beholder. Dreamlike and terrifying.

aspect_ratio_usage.3:4: Standard panels in 2x2 grid layouts. Most common ratio for dialogue and action.
aspect_ratio_usage.9:16: Tall/splash panels for dramatic reveals, character deaths, epic moments.
aspect_ratio_usage.16:9: Wide landscape panels for establishing shots, battles, and journey sequences.
aspect_ratio_usage.1:1: Square panels - avoid for grid layouts. Use only for specific artistic effect.
